author: {'steamid': '76561198000197453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1675038982}
review: Not a bad VR experience. It may be on the shorter side, but the environments are highly detailed and very animated. My only real issue is that it should have just been called "Canyon VR" as it seems very small in scale in comparison to the real Grand Canyon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258443509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1671308388}
review:
Grand Canyon is a fun and inexpensive VR experience that will allow you to really showcase your VR set up to all your friends, relatives and whoever else happens to drop by and can spare 10 minutes trying out VR for the first time. This is not a game, it is an experience and, therefore, has no replay value except after updates as more "Experiences" are built into the simulation. With an HTC Vive, the immersion is quite good. You can almost feel the sun beating down on you as you make your way down river. With 3rd gen VR rigs including the Valve Index, HTC Vive Pro 2 or Meta Pro, the realism goes up several notches.
I have found Grand Canyon to be the perfect introduction VR title to use with those who can be, let's say, a bit put off by the experience VR offers, which can be disorienting to some. Not so with Grand Canyon, even my most VR skitish female friend loved Grand Canyon and has broadened her horizons with Google Earth, which when she first tried it, caused her to sceam in terror and tear off the headset! roflmao
Final word: Face it, we all love showing off our stuff and for a measly $2.99, you can own the ultimate initiate experience to gently ease neophytes into the brave new world of VR. Buy it! (No - I don't work for the Devs - lol)

author: {'steamid': '76561198144161208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1624040358}
review:
Premier essai de 61mn ,  après avoir lu les critiques , j 'ai  été hésitant  avant d'acheter ce voyage au  the Grand Canyon.
j'en ai pris plein les yeux  et savourer ma ballade .i love vr .
une cloche de droite pour un parcours la nuit avec la torche c 'est cool .
une cloche de gauche  pour un voyage le jour ,....animé par un moteur qui nous permet de ralentir ou accélérer  notre vitesse.    des poissons ,grenouille ,lapin ,iguane,oiseaux,(biche ,il me semble)
moi j'adore. et c'est très joli. reposant . la montagne est belle.
et si sa suffit pas  vous pouvez a l’arrière de votre siège  prendre deux pagaies pour un parcours  en toute liberté.....
il faut savoir ramer....sa s'apprend...dur dur  mais  cool . pour moi  c' est une pépite d'or ce jeu...
si on pouvait en avoir plus de jeu aussi bien fait  en vr   sur ce thème  je suis consommateur   
3 euros c 'est donné , et non du gâchis.     les goûts et couleurs  ....voila je ne comprend pas le négatif  on aime ou on aime pas...pour moi très content  de cette pépite  d'or.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003199347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1573424541}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049197031', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1633005408}
review:
It is a nice relaxing experience with VR.  Simple to use and simple to experience.  Sometimes after a hard night of gaming.  It's a great choice.

Active skies and dynamic areas and sounds.  Very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964636851', 'num_games_owned': 2864, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1552185624}
review:
+Kayak through Grand Canyon
+Fun
+Beautiful
+Price for short experience is pretty good

-Fairly short
-Controls are meh

4/5

Would definitely pick this up and show it off to first time vr users, it's a really beautiful experience that puts you kayaking in the middle of the Grand Canyon, where I'd rather be there in person, sometimes you don't have that option to travel whenever you want. And where this isn't as good as the real thing, it is really fantastic, and it does give you a taste of what the real thing would be like. 

If you liked this review Make sure to [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33220185-VR-Games-and-Tools/]Click here[/url] and give a follow for more reviews of good, bad and decent VR titles. And [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/HonestVR/]Click here[/url] if you want to request reviews on other VR titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989610886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1529722159}
review: This "game" is basically just really boring. The premis of the experience is that you're in an immersive grand canyon kayak tour but there isn't enough presentation quality or detail to call this immersive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041215776', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1530983583}
review: Una boita experiecia para enseñar a tus amigos que no juegan o se marean con la VR

author: {'steamid': '76561198096525233', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1566066164}
review:
Although this is not a game, I still really enjoyed it.
I just put on some calm music, put the boat on a slow pace and relaxed.
This helped me cheer me up after feeling down and I am pretty sure I will cheer my up sometime again.

No, it is not very interactive and I wish it had the possibility to use paddles to add some more interaction.
Nevertheless, I really enjoyed the view and the water sound. The breeze I felt that came in through my window when I went through the waterfall made it really feel nice and magical, like I was really there. I haven't been in the Grand Canyon myself in real life, so I can't tell if it is accurate or not.

The possibility to go out the boat on certain places and just enjoy the view is also something I like. It gives another perspective and feeling.

It is not a long experience, although it is possible to experience this in day mode and night mode which give it an entire different feel.
For the €2,99 I payed, I can't complain and I would probably use this for someone to eighter cheer them up or for someone who hasen't VR at all to show them what it can do.

Thanks alot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964034834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1535395830}
review:
I bought before the new price of £1.99.  I've always enjoyed using this in combination with a rowing machine make things a little more interesting.  The experience isn't designed for rowing machines but you can always gather your stats using a different application and use this as a pleasant trip.
I would like to see this with the ability to plug into a rowing machine (waterrower or concept2) and gather stats or have the kayak move at the speed your rowing.
As it stands its a very nice experience and to me not like the Grand Canyon but its a Grand Canyon in its own right and worth going back to time and time agai.  If for a slightly different reason to what it was designed for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119412142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1614444822}
review: I enjoyed this game.  The ride was peaceful and you can pick the speed at which the boat goes. As I get travel sick easily in VR it was nice to have that slow speed setting.  The only issues I had was I could not pick up the fish food to feed the fish, and I also had a feeling that the cliffs looked like all the old cartoons I ever saw of the grand canyon and would not have been suprised if willie coyote ran past.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970854100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1710666989}
review: I really enjoy it. I wouldn't have called it "Grand Canyon" because honestly you don't get the sense that you are in the bottom of the Grand Canyon... but it is a very well done simulation of a "red rock canyon" of somewhere in the American Southwest. 4/5 stars from me. Not bad for a few dollars! I just wish there were more VR experiences like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972090300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1515925954}
review: It's Grand! ... also canyon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068725008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1547653830}
review: You can't really do much. The boat moves on a predefined path. It would be better if you could control it and move it as you like and maybe even walk around on the land.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985971681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1505088531}
review:
Having been to the bottom of the canyon (Bright Angel Campground / Phantom Ranch area)..... this doesn't look anything like the grand canyon to me. Maybe there's a side creek/canyon somewhere that looks kind of like this? The rocks, the vegetation, the sense of scale & awe are nothing at all like the GC. Maybe some sandstone canyon elsewhere in the southwest. What you can see pales compared to even the inner gorge of the real GC.

I'd have been more positive if this weren't marketed as a grand canyon experience, but that would only upgrade it from "annoyed I spent $5 on it" to "meh". I realize it's an interactive experience, not a game, but I was hoping for something that transported me to another place and made me feel immersed in it. Some other, better done VR experiences have done that.... this really didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198362200014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1499540361}
review: A bit disappointed in this game.  The whole point of the grand canyon are the craved faces on the rocks but none.  Instead all you get is a boat trip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006689642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1500582826}
review:
This experience was neither bad nor good.
The whole experience in this VR App is that you can either sit on a chair or sit inside a boat on a fully automated trip through the canyon :-/

No "replay" value which is really sad, since the Grand Canyon VR Experience could have been much much better.
Sure, the graphics do their job, but the times when they would have been state of the art have really been gone for a long time ... 

Since this vr app was most likely developed by a small team, I think there wasn't more possible, especially since the vr market is still very small. I hope that they try sth new with the experiences they made by developing the grand canyon vr experience.

Unfortunatelly I still can't recommend this 'game' since real experience can be made in this little  automated tech demo :-/.

author: {'steamid': '76561198384127453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1499512757}

author: {'steamid': '76561198096412999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1554931296}
review:
This is a sit-down virtual canoe tour of the Grand Canyon.

Some people will think this is boring.
But I'm intrigued by VR tourism. I also enjoy Zen relaxing VR experiences. So on both accounts I enjoyed this.

Just understand that it's not a "game", but a relaxing tour. If that sounds good to you, then hop in!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018471812', 'num_games_owned': 1247, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1490040728}
review:
[h1][b]グランドキャニオン河川周遊がVRで楽しめる[/b][/h1]

まず本作はストアページにも記載されている通りVRゲームではありません。

[h1]コンテンツ設定[/h1]

実際のグランドキャニオンがどのようなものかわかりませんが、グランドキャニオンにある河川の決まったコースをモーターのついたカヌーのようなもので周遊して様々な景色や生物を見て楽しむという体験型コンテンツです。

コースは同じなのですが夜間と昼間の二通りを楽しむことができます。昼間の場合はコースを時計逆回り、夜間は時計回り。

[h1]操作方法[/h1]

本作はカヌーのようなものに乗ってコース内を回るだけなので体験者が操作できるのは以下になります。

・HMDでの視点の移動
物理的に見渡せる範囲で自由自在、まるで本当にカヌーに乗っているかのような錯覚を覚える。

・カヌーのモーターのオン・オフ
観察したいものがあった場合、カヌーを止めることによってじっくり観察できる。

・ヘッドマウントライトのオン・オフ
昼間の日陰で見通しの悪い場所を照らしたり、夜間コースで周囲を照らすことができる。

[h1]個人的感想[/h1]

グラフィックの質はかなり割愛されていてディズニー映画に出てくるようなテイストの風景が楽しめる。

しかし日差しや水・植物といった環境要素はちゃんと物理演算的に再現されており前でのグラフィックテイストはさして気にならなくなりそれ相応に周遊アトラクションを楽しめた。そうしてコースを回ると様々な生物や植物を見ることができてソコソコ夢中になれた。夜間コースの落ちてくるような星空は圧巻、ヘッドライトのルーメンもちゃんと計算されていて際限なく照らすのではなく照度の限界を感じる部分もリアリティがあって良かった。

コンテンツそのものにヒネリはないが[b]「VRとはこういうもの」[/b]をわかりやすく形にしたコンテンツとも言える。

[h1]残念な点[/h1]

周遊カヌーに乗るだけのコンテンツであるなら、そこで出会うことができる植物や生物の名称や説明くらいは入れてほしかった。透き通る水の中を泳いでるのがトラウトなのかサーモンなのかもわからないまま終わるのはとても味気なかったです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198236524094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1570479662}
review:
A very enjoyable VR experience, but definitely not a game, but I am perfectly happy with that.  I just wish steam offered a VR Experiences category, that way those people that only want games would stop being disappointed.
Firstly, lets address a few of the complains people seem to have firstly price, play time: I have now had 2 full play throughs sessions of this game trying both day and night modes taking my time and stopping from time to time to soak up the experience and I have clocked up 1.5 Hours of play time for £6.99 so from my point of view the price seems fair as its about the same price as downloading a movie.  But I also except if you rush round and only play this ones or miss the night or day modes and just play one time off day going at full boat speed you can finish this much quicker, but I think you would be missing the point.
Secondly, I would say the graphics are quite good for a VR game, but live all games and experiences the resolution is limited by the current generation of high end graphics cards and VR headsets.
The only thing I do feel a Grand Canyon VR experience could do with is a second view from above to give a better feeling of scale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001165810', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1505913672}
review: Beautiful but short trip through the environment with day/night cycle.  Kayak mechanics work very well, but I would prefer being able to move around more freely. Visuals and sound quality is good. Little opportunity for interaction apart from feeding the fish. There is some (but not a lot of) animal life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303974326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1673, 'last_played': 1561328651}
review:
I have played this "Game/App" through multiple revisions and am extremely impressed with how it has evolved and improved. Both the Day and Night experiences in the Kayak are excellent and each quite different. The range of living creatures now experienced is quite large. I have seen a Deer, a Hare (Jackrabbit), two large Lizards (Gila Monsters?), many different Birds, many Bats in the tunnel to the Waterfall, many Fish and many Frogs. Also there are Fireflies, Butterflies and other assortd Insects. I hear Coyotes at night; wish I could see them! The Fish can be fed with pellets from the Can on the floor.

In addition, the Rendering of the Rocks is superb, especially close up with Flashlight illumination, and the clear Water with ripples is impressive. Little touches such as noise and vibration when the Kayak rides over rocks or branches in the water adds greatly to the realism. Flowers, plants, trees are all impressive, especially when they sway realistically in the wind.

This work is exactly why I enjoy VR and it is impressive how the product has evolved. I would like to draw attention to a few, albiet minor, flaws or possible improvements that are noted to help the Developers:

1. At night the Moon changes from a half Disc to a quarter Crescent to a very thin Crescent, all in a single run. This cannot be in the real world; this evolution follows a 28 day cycle and should be fixed during the experience. It would be clever if it were to be Full or different Crescents on successive trips but this might be a hardship for the rendering of the illumination of the rocks.

2. I fed a Fish and it then swam right through the Kayak as if it were full of water and not an obstruction.

3. I wish the Frogs would swim a bit longer and not just blink out of existance.

4. I can find the Gila Monsters at night but wish that there were Eyes reflecting the Light, not necessarily with a visible Animal.

5. The Flashlight is very good but there is a somewhat unrealistic distance cut-off of the illumination. This conflicts with the real life experience. Also it would be nice if, when selected ON, it were to stay ON without holding the Trigger, perhaps toggle ON/OFF with successive Trigger pulls. Also I found a mode where it is a Head-Mounted light but this (I think) requires the PC Keyboard Control Key to be pressed. The Motor's Speed Control does not require to be held; if released it stays at the chosen setting; the Flashlight should do the same.

6. I have commented before that the Waterfall, although very good, does not interact with the Lake water, which would in real life be very turbulent.

This is one of the two Apps (The Blu is the other) that I use to introduce new Viewers to VR and I am hoping that further evolution can be anticipated. Very good work everyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1484762437}
review:
VR | GTX 1060 Gameplay Footage: (With Commentary)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z5u_T00d4Hc

My Thoughts:
There's a pecking order for showing people VR for the first time and this NEW experience ranks up as one of them! It may not be a long ride for it's price but you do get to discover new animals and sights with each new ride.

Game Details:
Explore one of nature's greatest wonders from the comfort of your home with the Grand Canyon VR Experience for HTC VIVE and Oculus Rift! Transport yourself on an epic journey into the heart of nature through the magic of Virtual Reality completely immersed in a fully dynamic and interactive beauty

author: {'steamid': '76561198146417047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1484359753}
review:
At $2.99 this would be a semi-reasonable purchase.  For $9.99 I expect a measure of artistry, and that artistry just isnt here.  this basically feels less like the great outdoors than it does one of those rides at a cheap amusement park.  ohhhh look, theres some sort of styrofoam cactus.  huh, theres an animatronic lizard.  oh there is a bird projected on the ceiling (which i cant move my head to look at or the game jitters).

pros:

if i put the game on absolute highest quality and dont ever move my head, there is a measure of immersion.

i appreciate the effort to put wild animals in the game

the ambient sounds are lovely


cons:

guys seriously $9.99?  its one scene and it lasts less time than it took for me to download it.

gtx 1060 card, when i move my head in the game the jitter is very, very bad.  moving my head in TheBlu however has no jitter.  perhaps a better card might not have this problem but its not like this has a lot of moving pieces to render.

the trout are a nice touch but the decision to layer a second 'shimmering' image over them only made me honestly think 'oh ok, so the trout are all paired up with mates or something..?' until i realized this was an attempt to emulate water refraction.  it doesnt land, that effect.

why are there massive iguanas here?  no such animal in the grand canyon.  if you want gila monsters, open up blender and alter your iguana assets to make gila monsters.  or go ba77s deep and throw in some dinosaurs and krakens.  but commit, either way.  you shouldnt be phoning it in with vanilla Unity store assets in a $9.99 game.

'artificial intelligence' in the animals?  stop.  just knock it off.  frogs jumping off lily pads when youre X feet away doth not AI make.  

the quality of the visuals on the absolute highest level is only slightly better than what i 'experience' in a vintage Road Runner vs Wil-e Coyote cartoon.  

and again im sorry if this feels nit picky but a) its really not and b) when youre charging $9.99 for an experience game, you need to come correct.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358045868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1483908552}
review: Wow, just WOW!  One of the most relaxing and immersive experiences I ever had... so nice to just chill out in this world. Night time is definitly my fav

author: {'steamid': '76561198019046685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1585698383}
review: A must have for the Vive!  I could spend all day in laying back and floating down stream in this experience!  After the latest update the visual are extremely polished and look astonishing! You can relax on a railed boat ride or freely explore by paddling yourself.  There are a mix of smart AI and animatronic AI.  If you are on the railed ride you get a can of fish food that you can use to attract marine life to the surface!  Both the Night and Day modes are fantastic and the 3D audio drowns out the last bit of the real world!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992536733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1472387482}
review: One of the worst VR experience soo far. Rowing with the Vive controls are just a pain. Sorry but I don't really get the point here..

author: {'steamid': '76561198119883140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1470197242}
review: Trying out a lot of VR apps/games these days, although pretty cheap, this isn't even worth the few bucks it costs . Barely good enough for a demo in my opinion. Don't bother unless you really are out of VR experiences, but do not expect much: not particularly well made, the possibilities of movement/teleportation are *very* limited, and it gets boring within the first minute of try. I have been very forgiving judging VR experiences considering the very young state of the industry (and yet, there are some very cool stuff out there) but this it not one of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969913402', 'num_games_owned': 3553, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1558661225}
review:
So I've used this thing for a while.  It's not a game, it's an "experience" because that's something you can do in VR... experience things.  I really want to give these guys a thumbs up but I can't... Why not?  I've never been to the Grand Canyon so I can't say for sure whether or not it's authentic... What I [b]CAN[/b] say isn't authentic is that the resolution is crap and it detracts from the experience when you look at the scenery and see this jagged pixellated crap.    Apparently there's a tweak you can do that might wind up adding some much needed smoothing to those pixellated edges, but it requires a really beefy card to leave it turned on for everything.

So the aliasing is a big problem for stuff in the distance, but it's also got some problems with walls being way too "flat" with sharp corners up close.  Am I going through the Grand Canyon or is this the lego recreation of the Grand Canyon?

Things I liked:
[list]
 [*] You get to experience what it might be like to paddle down the Colorado River through the Grand Canyon.  
 [*] You get a flashlight, paddles, and a way to teleport yourself in cases where moving would take you out of the room scale play area
 [*] paddling the little canoe thing doesn't make you sick but still gives that sensation you're moving
 [*] if you lean left and right over the seated area you will see the sides of the "canoe" thing dip into the water as it reacts to the shifting weight.
[/list]

Things I didn't like:
[list]
 [*] Crappy resolution
 [*] Crappy water textures (They're working on it I guess?)
 [*] I'm not even sure what I'm supposed to do other than paddle around
 [*] There's no map or anything so you're not even sure how far you can go
 [*]  Nightfall comes pretty quickly so without the flashlight it gets pretty hard to see, and what there is to see isn't that interesting.  
 [*] You can use two paddles (each controller being a paddle) but there really isn't a good way to make it feel like you're actually rowing.  I wound up most of the time using one controller as a paddle and the other as a flashlight/teleport thing most of the time.
[/list]

Really though most of what irked me about this game wasn't the graphics.  I wanted to like it.  It's a cool idea...I just feel like they need more direction.  Which way should I paddle?  How far can I go?  Is there supposed to be something to see at night?  Maybe they could add some narration from someone famous (or not famous) about the local wildlife or rock formations, or history of the area or something.  

Instead I feel like it's just "paddle around, maybe see some stuff....maybe see something to make you feel like it was worth the trip but probably not".  Like maybe if they had an Indian Village to visit, or showed some especially iconic and beautiful scenery... the way I felt, it could have just been "generic river through generic canyon with generic plants".  Google "grand canyon river" and look at the pictures and compare that to what you see in game... it's not even close.

The most interesting thing I saw was an empty Canoe going by on its own... I decided I'd paddle up to it and try to get into it and maybe see if there were some clues to the owner, but nope...there was no way to stop it from going off on its own (was it motorized?) and I couldn't get into it... It was a nicer "canoe" than the one I started with since the one I started with looked more like a surfboard than a boat...  

Maybe there was something there... like the beginning of a mystery that I had to figure out, but the problem is, they didn't give me any tools to stop the boat, examine it closer or anything.... I feel like the whole thing was wasted opportunity.

EDIT:  So I figured out what I was missing... When you first start out and walk to the pier, there's a picture of a canoe with "360°" and an arrow around it, and under that is a yellow cube.  Touch the yellow cube with your controller and you're teleported to that canoe on it's pre-programmed circuit of the area.

The problem is, if you try to do ANYTHING with your controllers, you're zapped back to the pier again.   If you wait long enough the canoe will go right past the pier and you can follow on the other "surfboard" boat, and maybe get in front of it and let the canoe push you along.

It would have been nice if you could speed the boat up, but nothing I did seemed to affect it without zapping me back to the pier again.

Buy it cheap if you must, but don't expect to be amazed by the experience.  Any time you come close to feeling in awe of something, the jagged graphics will remind you that you're in VR.  It's a shame really.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990460875', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1470708272}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009590386', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1466799964}
review:
Short Review:
The boat locomotion is terrably slow and unrealistic. Giant waste of time. The graphics are about what you'd expect from a VR game, and the gameplay is nothing special.

Long Review:
This game made me look up how to refund games on steam. I was only able to play for the first few minutes because I couldn't get anywhere. You can only teleport to certain locations, and then you're forced into a boat that you have to row yourself, which wouldn't be a negative if it was realistic. Here I am making these big broad gestures with my arms and I'm only moving an inch or two per swing. I swear it would have taken me a half an hour just to get to the other side of the lake. That doesn't even count the fact that I have no idea where to go. Is the starting area the only area in the game? I don't know, and I wasn't about to spend half an hour rowing accross a lake to find out. If the boat had some sort of automation or if you could teleport anywhere (like in other VR games) i probably would have kept this game, but the locomition system makes it unplayable. The graphics and gameplay are nothing special, and they don't make up for the horrible locomotion. Use your money to buy some other VR game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198089055363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1481434014}
review: I was looking forward to trying this out especially after the devs revamped the paddle system, so I picked it up during the Steam Sales.  Unfortunately, it's rife with bugs and just feels unpolished.  It needs a huge dose of anti-aliasing or just any graphics options.  The paddle physics, while cool in concept, don't feel right.  They're very slow, even paddling with 2 hands.  There is some graphical bug which makes the water almost black at certain angles (like looking down), but it changes, which really takes you out of the immersion.  I thought the kayak might fare better, but it is entirely on-rails.  Why not give the same freedom as with the paddle board?  That would be great.  But I tried it and needed to re-center, only to find myself now underneath the boat!  I really wanted to like this, but it's so buggy and almost unplayable as is.  I would refund it, but it was so cheap I'll keep it so hopefully the devs will fix this up.  It has potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280562237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1466627749}
review: Havent played much yet but seems exactly what I was after, relaxing exploration. Water and water spashes need improvment but think i saw they are fixing that. The only other issue for me is the board is a bit too responsive when i paddle it makes the scene move too quickly and jerky, makes me feel a little funny prob not going to stop me exploring yet. I feel its missing that slow lag you get from real paddling.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968576925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1491520644}
review:
Updates are still coming, so this may improve further in the future.
But for now, it's only great for demoing VR to your friends and making them think something somewhere is actually going to jump out of the shadows at them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009434744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1490709771}
review: Is this picture perfect? Is this action packed? Is it bug free? No, not at all. The graphics are slightly dated looking, I have gotten stuck while paddling, the paddling mechanic is a little tricky to get right. BUT taking some time and sitting on my floor in the middle of my paddlboard and watching the sun go down behind the cliffs and the stars come out....that was an amazing experience. Recommended for that reason alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962242093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1514577964}
review:
I really enjoyed the trip. I espescially like the plans & flowers and the animals even if they (the animals) are rarely seen. But just watching a bird high in the sky fly over you makes the enviorment feel so real. the clouds and the lightning are vere well made so that the shift from day to night is really great.

But like already mentioned from other guys the are some cons:

- its quite short, in 15-20 mins you seen everything
- the thin lines from the leaves etc. look blury in vr (at distance)
- the paddle with vive is much to slow and to anoying. it would be very helpfull if with one "strike" you will float like 10 meters so you don't have to paddle all the time

All in all a very nice and relaxing experiance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074122609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1482809693}
review: This was a fantastic experience. Really shows off what can be done with motion controllers in VR. The light and water effects look great as well as the physics and movement of the kayak and paddle. Not too much to do apart from paddle around the waters close to the canyon, but wow was that immersive and fun. A suggestion to the devs, if we could have the ability to leave the kayak and teleport to the top of the canyon I think it would add another level of awesome, being able to see from a higher vantage point and perspective.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999839179', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1463129301}
review:
Tout partait d'une bonne idée mais le résultat n'est pas là !
[list]
    [*]Contrôles pénibles avec le paddle (obligé de ramer tout le temps)
    [*]On avance sur un rail et non librement...
    [*]Visuellement c'est joli sur l'écran mais pas dans le Vive, les herbes et feuilles sont bien trop détaillées, bilan = une soupe de pixels...
    [*]Bien trop court
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198023247531', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1484699199}
review: 其实本不想推荐次体验，因为质量不太好，画面效果作为风景体验太卡通，制作者水平一般吧。UE4的画面本可以更好的，就像伊森卡特的消失。玩法就是左手手电筒，右手划皮艇，扑哧扑哧的按既定路线划】，没啥大的变化。虽说现在还是抢鲜体验，dan一年了感觉没啥大变化

author: {'steamid': '76561198072421557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1471682832}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994380420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1461572418}
review: Horrible controlls for the paddle board, on rails and the paddling just takes forever. Lots of the visuals are not great for VR (thin lines on grass and foileage). Might be a lot more fun if you could actually move around freely instead of on rails.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965934721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1476508493}
review: Pretty neat. Very immersive and makes you feel like you're really there. The sounds are great. I was hoping to see the canyon's true size from the top, or fly above the canyon in a helicopter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032177308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1479358355}
review:
Found this way too real, accidently spawned at night, fumbled with a torch, splashed myself with water, freaked out, worried about the amount I was tilting from side to side as water ran onto my kayak.

I then restarted during the day, marvelled at the graphics, the fish swimming, the haptic feedback, but I was still too unnerved by the night time experience and the granduer and size of the place and stopped playing, half expecting to be eaten by a dinosaur.

For $5 it's a cool experience, great to showcase VR to friends and family, not sure of it's ultimate replayability, but it was a lot of fun on my first try

author: {'steamid': '76561198191822587', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1460632388}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056779029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1459563238}
review:
As an early access game, the developers have done an excellent job on the initial visual graphics.

It will be an interesting one to follow as it progresses into a full release, as there are various bugs at the moment that need to be ironed out, but I've played far worse early access games than this for a far higher price.

One thing that I do like (so far) about this game is that the developers appear to be very interactive with the community... I really hope that continues as the game continues to grow!

So, the bugs so far.

The first is with the DK2. Okay, if you're reading this in a few months time you may have the CV1, but the DK2 is almost impossible to run with the required runtime. There IS a way to use the game with the DK2 that works well, but it's a problem that a lot of DK2 users will have. 

Secondly, it is very much geared up to be controller based. The keyboard commands don't currently work, which means that unless you have motion controllers there's very little to do...

BUT, don't let that put you off. They do seem like a great team and I'm really expecting these little issues to be solved as the game progresses.

For the price, it's worth it. Get a bargain while you can...

author: {'steamid': '76561198066468698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1462387662}

author: {'steamid': '76561198162937551', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1479501013}

author: {'steamid': '76561198133976496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1452781628}
review:
j'ai téléchargé ce "jeu" par erreur en pensant qu'il y avait un rapport avec le grand Canyon et une tentative de reproduire fidelement au moins une petite partie de celui-ci et qu'il s'agissait d'un jeu où il y avait un minimum d'interactions, en fait vous tournez en rond sur un petit circuit " bouclé en moins de 4 minutes à vitesse normale"
il n'y a rien à faire, vous êtes dans un manège façon grand 8, avec les sensations en moins, et rien n'est fidèle à l'ambiance du grand canyon, la nuit tombe brusquement comme si quelqu'un venait d'éteindre la lumière.....les pierres et les plantes ont été "badigeonnées" à la bombe luminescente pour parfaire le coté attraction de foire, pour les curieux qui voudraient quand même aider le dévellopeur, SURTOUT NE BOUGEZ PAS LA TÊTE !! les éclairages dynamiques bougent plus en fonction de la position du casque que de celle du "soleil"....même avec un PC dernier cri en I7 6XXXX avec 32 gigas de memoire DDR4 et des cartes GTX 980 en SLI, c'est bourré d'artefacts et de trainées diverses qui suivent les objets lorsque vous bougez trop vite, alors le coté relaxant.....on en reparlera après les grosses mises à jour qui s'impossent, les bourdonnements d'abeille et les bruits de canoé qui raclent le fond sont également mal choisis pour une experience VR sensée être orientée vers la relaxation  ( au boulot)

author: {'steamid': '76561198202568578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1451683589}
review: Very relaxing and unique VR Experience, love the animals all around you and the way the weather changes as you go along! One of the very few experiences where I actually felt presencevery very cool :))))))))

author: {'steamid': '76561198037003788', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1451949218}
review: yes-yes, it's nice, but also this is one of the shortest demos I have seen and usually this kind of stuff used to be free. I got 50% discount and still paid *way* too much. 5€ for 2 minutes is far from good deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004857620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1574376760}

i use  a dk2 ,good headphones, and a hammock  (to simulate the movements of the kayak) ,i like
the trip in the night,its a fantastic Experience ,after a while you can imagine ,you are in the canyon!!
thanks for the virtual dream!! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067038041', 'num_games_owned': 4188, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1459441521}
review: It's pretty but seems like it wouldn't take much effort to make it longer or add some additonal trails for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970541793', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1473817014}
review:
It is decently well made, but I can't say it was immersive or enjoyable. If I was to introduce somebody to the rift, this isn't one of the selections I'd pick to show. 

Mostly you are a floating body on a kayak ride in a loop. Not much to do, the scenery is OK.. but that is about it. A lot gets lost as the try to use high details which don't translate well and make the experience feel dated in graphics.

Suspect this is just an early prototype before they make it a kayak fishing game. Then I could see it being pretty good with the HTC. (holding paddles, fishing rod, etc.)

But as now.. it is a 5/10 sorta meh. Pick it up if you want to support the developers and throw some money early on at the VR world.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969504933', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1446061043}
review:
This is one of the better VR experiences I've had so far.  The graphics are pretty damn good and the devs did a great job setting the mood in the virtual canyon :) I can honestly say for once I took off the DK2 more relaxed than when I put it on.

Like most early access games there are some bugs but they're minimal, and since the team sent out three updates since the release of the game a month ago I feel this really won't be a problem. 

Hope to see more of these guys soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096242278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1458864918}
review:
Really good experience with oculus rift. Ran smooth as butter on epic settings with my i7 4790k and gtx 980ti and looked really nice to boot!

The water oh man so serene and relaxing. I really wanted to put my hand in the water and at one point i extended my hands outward in an attempt to do so lol. 

Totally recommend to anyone who enjoys a vr experience that has to do with nature. Only gripe was that it's too short! But Im hoping they will add more seeing how it's early access. Worth 10 dollars as is imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027020545', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1457246499}
review: Very relaxing game to experience in the DK2. I have a friend who has done multiple rafting trips down the grand and he  raves about it. This gives me a taste of that. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034419607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1444715167}
review: Absolutely incredible.  Now, to be fair, on my (pretty good) system I experienced a lot of judder and black smear / right eye vsync issues on my DK2, but I fault the young technology and my own setup, not the devs of this game, for that.  This was a very impressive demonstration of the future of VR experiences.  I may actually have my parents over and make them strap on my Rift to see this.  10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042814201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1452105563}
review:
There's one thing that comes to my mind: Detail.

The sheer amount of detail put into the environment is stunning. The textures look incredible, geometry is great, all coupled with procedural AI animals that react to the environment naturally, AND in VR? That's too much for one person to ask for a small purchase.

But the game delivers big time on it's promise: Being a nice relaxing, while still engaging, experience. 

And the kayak freaking tips when you lean over the side!

But still, this is a great experience, if only it ran better on my PC. Currently running an I7 4790K and 2 GTX 770s, and that was enough to get me a judder-free experience on medium. High has issues, and Epic is out of the question. Note, this is all with the Oculus Rift on, and to get the best experience possible you need at least 75FPS.

Overall, it's a great experience and is worth a try, but could do with some performance improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028849667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1444422584}
review: Graphics are awful unfortunately even on Epic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059301883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1444351651}
review:
The fact that the Kayak tips with your head movement in the VR HMD is just GREAT! Love that feeling of affecting my movement in such a simple way. Some textures are very vivid and detailed and still others have some work to do, but overall I was impressed with the visual and sound quality of what is available so far! Hope to see the project continue into development and excited for the potential!
THE WATERFALL GOT ME! I knew full well that I was in a VR but approaching the waterfall I really was in AWE by how realistic the water looked and sounded as it approached! Very well done! I felt the need to duck thinking I was about to get soaked.. haha (https://youtu.be/OCxPUmVaBJ4) 
If you enjoy nature and vr experiences then definitely check this one out!
by the way i love people because Jesus loves me

author: {'steamid': '76561198023380870', 'num_games_owned': 949, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1640398685}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030678742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1444404592}
review: some of the best water and sky i have seen in a game or vr the sun lighting is probably the most realistic i have seen i love people because Jesus loves me
